intro: Humbertiella henricii, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker, is a rare flowering plant native to the highlands of Mexico. It is characterized by its striking red, tubular flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is known for its ornamental value due to its vibrant color and unique shape. Humbertiella henricii thrives in well-drained soil and requires full sun to partial shade for optimal growth. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
